summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from September 2019 between an Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) in the Southern District of New York and defense attorney Javier A. Solano. The emails discuss scheduling and the government's interest in interviewing Solano's client, referred to as 'Estill', regarding the Epstein matter, noting an ICE detainer on the client.

persons.name: Javier A. Solano
persons.context: Attorney representing a client named Estill; communicating with the U.S. Attorney's Office to schedule a proffer session regarding the Epstein matter and inquiring about an immigration hold on his client.

persons.name: Estill
persons.context: Client of attorney Javier A. Solano; subject of an ICE detainer; the government was considering interviewing him regarding the Epstein matter.

connections.description: Solano is the legal representative for Estill, arranging a proffer session with prosecutors and inquiring about his client's immigration status.
Professional correspondence regarding scheduling a proffer session for Solano's client and the government's interest in interviewing him about Epstein.

events.title: ICE Detainer Confirmed for Estill
events.description: An AUSA confirms to attorney Javier Solano that his client Estill has an ICE (Immigration and Customs Enforcement) detainer.

events.title: Scheduled Proffer Session
events.description: A proffer session for Estill was initially scheduled for August 28, 2019, at 2:00 p.m. at the U.S. Attorney's office, but was later rescheduled due to Solano's trial schedule.

events.title: Government Interest in Epstein Interview Questioned
events.description: Attorney Solano forwards an inquiry asking if the government is still interested in interviewing his client regarding the Epstein matter, and an AUSA seeks clarification on whether the government is 'not interested' at that time.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Empire State Building, 350 Fifth Avenue, Suite 5900, New York, New York 10118
The Hub, 507 Willis Avenue, Bronx, New York 10455
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was in communication with a defense attorney about interviewing his client 'Estill' regarding the Epstein investigation in September 2019.
The client Estill was subject to an ICE (Immigration and Customs Enforcement) detainer, which was a factor in considering a bail application.
A proffer session between Estill and prosecutors was being scheduled but faced delays due to the defense attorney's trial commitments.
By September 12, 2019, there was an explicit question from the defense about whether the government remained interested in interviewing Estill on the Epstein matter.
